basis: The user explicitly commits to importing and using the two anchors, keeping the afternoon window fixed, allowing post-workout adaptability, and planning a weekly check-in. They also indicate immediate action (copying exact texts into reminders) and a readiness to defer the Go-To plan. This reflects strong alignment with the suggested steps and high likelihood of prompt execution.
cognitive_dissonance: Low. Clear alignment between goals and planned actions; minor tension around future Go-To planning and handling schedule drift.
negative_thought_patterns: Possible all-or-nothing thinking about adherence on rough days; occasional perfectionism about sticking to exact times.
emotional_triggers: Desire for structure and predictability; potential anxiety about missing reminders; relief from concrete, fixed anchors.
coaching_notes: Maintain bite-sized, executable steps. Reinforce the value of fixed anchors plus occasional flexibility. Support the weekly check-in as a lightweight accountability touchpoint. Consider adding a tiny nonfood coping option later to bolster resilience on rough days.
